DPRD Cimahi Minta Disnakertrans Perbarui Data Tenaga Kerja Asing
06 Nov 2019, 12:37 by Ririn Nur Febriani
CIMAHI, (PR).- Jajaran Komisi IV DPRD Kota Cimahi meminta Dinas Ketenagakerjaan dan Transmigrasi (Disnakertrans) Kota Cimahi lebih proaktif mendata pekerja asing yang ada di wilayah Kota Cimahi. Jangan sampai data tidak diperbaharui karena mengandalkan pengawasan oleh Provinsi Jabar.
Demikian diungkapkan Ketua Komisi IV DPRD Kota Cimahi, Ayis Lavilianto kepada wartawan di gedung DPRD Kota Cimahi, Jalan dra Djulaeha Karmita, Kota Cimahi, Rabu 6 November 2019.
"Kami menyesalkan Disnakertrans Kota Cimahi sampai tidak ada data pekerja asing terbaru. Harusnya secara proaktif mendata dan melihat di lapangan soal keberadaan tenaga kerja asing (TKA) tersebut," ujarnya.
Pernyataan tersebut berkaitan dengan insiden kebakaran pipa minyak akibat dihantam bor proyek yang dikerjakan PT Kereta Cepat Indonesia-China (KCIC) hingga menewaskan satu orang TKA pada 22 Oktober 2019. Disnaker Kota Cimahi mengklaim tidak memiliki data pekerja asing yang mengerjakan trase kereta cepat Jakarta-Bandung (KCJB) wilayah Cimahi karena kewenangan pendataan TKA  berada di Pemprov Jabar.
Menurut Ayis, para TKA yang mengerjakan trase kereta cepat wilayah Cimahi bisa jadi tidak melapor ke Disnakertrans Kota Cimahi karena bekerja lintas kota. "Kecuali tenaga asingnya memang bermukim di Cimahi," ucapnya.
Ayis mengetahui Disnakertrans Kota Cimahi memiliki data TKA namun sudah lama tidak diperbaharui. "Pernah ada data lama, itupun yang bekerja di pabrik tekstil dan garmen. Untuk yang sekarang belum ada data terbaru. Kita butuh data tersebut agar tahu keberadaan mereka, di samping kewajiban para TKA tersebut kepada negara Indonesia baik terkait pelaporan maupun retribusi yang harus dibayar," ungkapnya.
Diberitakan sebelumnya, Proyek KCJB yang dibangun pada trase wilayah Kelurahan Melong, Kecamatan Cimahi Selatan menyebabkan pipa pertamina meledak pada Selasa 22 Oktober 2019 lalu. Korban jiwa seorang TKA atas nama Li Xuanfeng, WNA asal China, personel operator alat berat bor dari subkontraktor CREC PT Ming Shun Construction yang mengerjakan trase KCJB wilayah Kota Cimahi.
Kepala Disnakertrans Kota Cimahi, Herry Zaini mengatakan pihaknya bakal proaktif mendata TKA untuk memastikan keberadaan mereka selama berada di wilayah Kota Cimahi. "Kalau perusahaan mengerjakan proyek di dua daerah, maka kepengurusan data TKA di Provinsi Jabar. Proyek KCIC ini mengerjakan di beberapa wilayah jadi enggak terdata di Disnaker Cimahi," ujarnya.
Demikian juga soal pengawasan TKA, kewenangannya kini ada di Disnaker Provinsi Jabar sesuai aturan terbaru. "Kami hanya melayani perpanjangan izin dari perusahaan tempat mereka bekerja, tidak ke hal pengawasan. Melihat kejadian kemarin, saat ini kami akan lebih proaktif lagi ke perusahaan yang memperkerjakan TKA. Meskipun kewenangan ada di provinsi, Pemkot Cimahi juga perlu data TKA karena mereka ada di wilayah Cimahi," ungkapnya.***

DPRD Cimahi Asks Manpower and Transmigration Office to Update Foreign Workers Data
06 Nov 2019, 12:37 by Ririn Nur Febriani
CIMAHI, (PR) .- The ranks of the Commission IV of the Cimahi City DPRD asked the Cimahi City Manpower and Transmigration Office (Disnakertrans) to be more proactive in registering foreign workers in the Cimahi City area. Do not let the data not be updated because it relies on supervision by the West Java Province.
This was stated by Chair of Commission IV of the Cimahi City DPRD, Ayis Lavilianto to reporters at the Cimahi City DPRD building, Jalan dra Djulaeha Karmita, Cimahi City, Wednesday 6 November 2019.
"We deplore the Cimahi City Manpower and Transmigration Office until there is no latest data on foreign workers. It should proactively record and see in the field about the existence of foreign workers (TKA)," he said.
The statement relates to the incident of an oil pipeline fire due to being hit by a drill project carried out by PT Indonesia-China Fast Trains (KCIC) to the death of one TKA on October 22, 2019. The Cimahi City Manpower Office claims it has no data of foreign workers working on the Jakarta-Bandung fast train track. (KCJB) in the Cimahi region because the TKA's data collection authority is in the West Java Provincial Government.
According to Ayis, the TKA who worked on the Cimahi high-speed train tract might not report to the Cimahi City Manpower Office because they worked across the city. "Unless the foreign workers do live in Cimahi," he said.
Ayis knows that the Cimahi City Manpower Office has TKA data, but has not been updated for a long time. "There have been old data, and even then, those working in textile and garment factories. For the present there is no recent data. We need these data to know their whereabouts, in addition to the obligations of the foreign workers to the Indonesian state both in terms of reporting and fees that must be paid, "he said.
Reported earlier, the KCJB Project, which was built in the Melong Kelurahan, Cimahi Selatan District, caused Pertamina pipes to explode on Tuesday, October 22, 2019. Victim of a TKA on behalf of Li Xuanfeng, a foreigner from China, a heavy equipment operator from the PT Ming Shun Construction CREC subcontractor who worked on the KCJB lineage in the Cimahi City area.
Head of the Cimahi City Manpower and Transmigration Office, Herry Zaini, said that his party would be proactive in registering foreign workers to ensure their existence while in the Cimahi City area. "If the company works on projects in two regions, the management of TKA data in West Java Province. This KCIC project works in several areas so it is not recorded in the Cimahi Manpower Office," he said.
Likewise with regard to the supervision of foreign workers, the authority is now in the West Java Province Manpower Office in accordance with the latest regulations. "We only serve the extension of permits from the companies where they work, not to the matter of supervision. Looking at yesterday's events, now we will be more proactive to companies that employ foreign workers. Although the authority is in the province, Cimahi City Government also needs TKA data because they are in the Cimahi region, "he said. ***
